Posts.Content: Jul 26, 2011 07:17PM Priscilla0929 wrote: I am a critical care nurse but can't work while my counts drop so now I am doing IT work at the hospital. I manage atleast 30 hours/week and miss a few hours n Friday for Herceptine and every 3rd for FEC/Herceptine. Plus I do the Neulasta the folloing Monday. It is doable but sometimes tiring. With 2 little kids at home it is tough but manageable. I could never sit home unless I start to feel really awful

Posts.Content: Jul 31, 2011 09:28PM Priscilla0929 wrote: I went through the same thing just this week. My onc was away and the office took the whole week to schedule my MRI. I asked the guy how he would feel walking around wondering like I have. There was just silence on the other end of the phone.  I think now I realize how mean people can be to eachother and I definitely don't want them mean to me.  I have to admit I also hate all the sad looks I get from everyone when I am out.  I am tired of people asking me how I manage with two babies...What do they think that does? It doesn't make me feel better but I know they mean well. It is tough

Posts.Content: Sep 7, 2014 01:28PM Priscilla0929 wrote: I am on it since May 2013. Doing well on it.... Cleared up all of my liver lesions. Just tired around day 3 and last two treatment I got weird low grade fevers. Other than that I am doing really great on it. Thank goodness for it!!!!
Posts.Title: Who's on Kadcyla/TDM1? Trish03 Denny123

Posts.Content: Dec 1, 2015 10:28PM Priscilla0929 wrote: I was diagnosed with Stage 4 mets to liver in 2011. Had recurrence Jan of 2013. Been on Kadcyla since March 2013 and cleared up my lesions. Unfortunately I have mets to brain now so working on that at the moment.... Kadcyla saved me when the Herceptin stopped working. Take care and keep us posted!

Posts.Content: Dec 3, 2011 12:37AM Priscilla0929 wrote: @ Jenna3-My quality of life is great as I am an active 33 year old.I am considering becuase now that I have responded so well I do not want to risk it coming back in the breast again.  It is not that I can't bear to have the breast or for any psychological reason..infact I don't want to take it off I just wish it never comes back or fully goes away. The only way I can think to prevent it from ever returning in the breast is to do the MX
Posts.Title: Kind of Confused Priscilla0929 jenrio

Posts.Content: Oct 24, 2011 09:16PM Priscilla0929 wrote: Thank you all for the info.  i am so overwhelmed lately.  I guess I never really grasped what was going on.  I went from being to diagnosed to Stage IV in a week.  Then the whirlwind of the port, MUGA, scan after scan, chemo, well you know.  Now I am on Taxol and Herceptine weekly and I guess the "dust is settled" now.  Maybe I want the MX for the wrong reason. Maybe it makes me feel like it still can all be ok.  I can't resect my liver bcs there are too many lesions so I guess the breast is my "hope" of maybe getting those 10 or 15 years I would like.  I don't know. Between the chemo, the worry, the little ones and it all I am beginning to feel like I am losing my mind.
Posts.Title: Kind of Confused Priscilla0929 jenrio

Posts.Content: Dec 3, 2011 12:55AM Priscilla0929 wrote: I was diagnosed with breast ca mets to liver in June--FEC (12 weeks) -after the scan showed lesions were not active on PET. Taxol x 12 weeks with herceptine-finished today-i am waiting to rescan in January. Is that dumb of me to do? I hope everything is going great and remember you are "4everhopeful" : )

Posts.Content: May 13, 2012 10:27PM Priscilla0929 wrote: Hi Stormynyte, I was 32 when I was diagnosed and my second child, a girl, was only 9 months old. I lived in a bliss for a week thinking I had Stage I but then that awful PET revealed diffuse mets to my liver.  I have accepted the fact that my kids will never know their young, care free, "healthy" mom.  It is terrible and I know how hard it is to listen to people who have lived their "almost" whole life and we wonder if we will ever live ours. Take care, Priscilla
